Welcome to Automation4all, your go-to destination for comprehensive and free training in the fields of Automation, Industry 4.0, IIOT (Industrial Internet of Things), Instrumentation , Software skills and more. We are committed to empowering learners of all levels with valuable insights, hands-on tutorials, and in-depth knowledge to excel in the dynamic world of industrial technology. Join us on a journey of continuous learning, as we explore the latest advancements, share expert insights, and provide practical skills to help you thrive in the realms of Instrumentation and Automation. posts.title: What is Industry 4.0? | Industrial revolution 4.0 | #industrialrevolution #industry4.0
posts.content: Today our topic is Industry 4.0. Fourth Industrial Revolution 4.0 is transforming manufacturing with smart, connected technology that revolutionizes production and supply chains. Discover how IoT, AI, and digital twins drive the future of industrial automation. Related Queries: industry 4.0 industry 4.0 technology industrial 4.0 supply chain what is industry 4.0 smart manufacturing digital transformation #Industry4.0 #FourthIndustrialRevolution #SmartManufacturing #DigitalTransformation #FactoryFlow

posts.title: The Growing Popularity of #Industry4.0 Bite-size approach
posts.content: Hi, thanks for watching our video about #Industry 4.0 bite size approach In the next, five to ten years Industries will be preparing to adopt Industry 4.0 elements as they won‚Äôt be able to sustain without these technological advancements. The fourth industrial revolution ‚Äì Industry 4.0 has brought tremendous changes in the manufacturing process. Industry 4.0 technologies aim at transforming industries into ‚ÄúSmarter factories‚Äù. Lean Transition Solution has a wide range of smart factory solutions that will help businesses to apply a ‚ÄúBite-Size‚Äù approach to Industry 4.0 and smart manufacturing. posts.title: How IoT works and manufacturing | IoT applications in Industries | Industry4.0 | IIoT | STABILITY
posts.content: Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) is an approach to computerized change in assembling. Mechanical IoT utilizes an organization of sensors to gather basic creation information and utilizations cloud programming to transform this information into important bits of knowledge about the productivity of the assembling tasks. IoT Manufacturing ‚Äì The web of things can possibly increment worldwide efficiency up to 25 percent by 2025. Which could mean a financial estimation of 11 trillion dollars. Enterprises like assembling are grasping the capability of the Internet of Things. The following is a rundown with a few IoT use cases in assembling and their advantages/real factors: 1. Manufacturing Operations 2. Production asset management and maintenance 3. Field Service 4. Other manufacturing IoT use cases In this video we are explaining - How IoT works and manufacturing - IoT applications in Industries To learn more, subscribe to our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCziV0F
posts.author: STABILITY

posts.title: What is Digital Twin? | Digital Twin Explanation | Industry4.0 | IoT | STABILITY AUTOMATION
posts.content: Digital Twin creates a dynamic mirror of your plants, lines, machines, products, and processes using our purpose-built digital twin, which produces a comprehensive, real time semantic context of process and product data. A digital twin is, basically, a PC program that utilizes true information to make reenactments that can foresee how a product or process will perform. These projects can coordinate the internet of things (Industry 4.0), artificial intelligence and programming investigation to improve the output. Digital twins are used in a wide variety of industries for a range of applications and purposes. Some of them are: -Manufacture -Automotive -Retail -Healthcare -Disaster Management -Smart Cities Digital twin is vital to the improvement of Industry 4.0 to give robotization, information trade and signed up assembling measures just as de-gambling item rollout. Industry representatives can screen activities continuously, giving earlier alarms of potential disappointments and ta
posts.author: STABILITY

posts.title: Can Industry4.0 be real for Indian Manufacturers? Meet sfHawk: The New Smart Shop Floor Supervisor!
posts.content: Great innovations come with passion, and Amitabh Chaturvedi of InnovaPoint is breaking the myth that industry 4.0 is premature for the Indian shop floors. Pune based InnovaPoint has been offering cutting-edge information technology solutions to their global customers for the past 17 years. It was after three failures in finding a right solution for Indian manufacturers to improve their shop floor productivity, this technocrat and his team was able to launch sfHawk ‚Äì a hardware empowered with a rigid digital platform bringing great benefits to their customers. What more, the sfHawk team is all set to go bigger this IMTEX 2023, and will be exhibiting the new smart digital shop floor supervisor, available at hall 4, stall 143. sf stands for Smart Factory and Hawk means keeping a good eye on the factory, enables the manufacturer to improve the overall efficiency of the production system, addressing the traceability issues, and overall quality improvement of the product. Along with these,
posts.author: Machine Maker

posts.title: Part 1- Short course on Digitalisation and Industry4.0
posts.content: The title of the Course is "The Smart Enough Factory: Achieving Low Cost, Low Skill, Low Risk Industry 4.0". The course discusses digitalisation options in manufacturing and shows that a Smart Enough Factory is 'smart enough' for Industry 4.0 today and not the future, where the smart factory will stay for some considerable time yet. Steve will share with you the experience of introducing low cost, low code and low risk Industry 4.0 technologies into some Australian SMEs. By highlighting the barriers that still remain, and demonstrating solutions he will show some Industry 4.0 patterns that you could be able to adopt in your facility today. He aims to show how to realise business value from Industry 4.0 and not just consider the technical aspects. Some of the components of the course are: Industry 4.0 for Productivity and Compliance A smart Enough Digital Strategy Opinionated Frameworks Discover your 'unknown unknowns' The course was delivered in 3 parts by Dr Steve Dowey.
posts.author: DSM Network

posts.title: Industry 4.0 #Industry4.0 #IndustrialRevolution
posts.content: Industry 4.0 is a big buzzword that is flying around Industrial Revolution. This fourth Industrial Revolution is all about smart factories with connected machines and intelligent robots. The first Industrial Revolution basically started in 1770s where machines were introduced ‚Ä¢ We moved from hand to machine ‚Ä¢ farms to the factories using steam and waterpower The second industrial revolution started with invention of electricity. ‚Ä¢ Automation and assembly lines in factories. The 3rd Industrial revolution started with innovation of computer in 1970. Computes helped to do revolution in banking, education and manufacturing. Industry 4.0 is about connectivity. it's an opportunity to radically change the way industry responds to the needs of society. The opportunities for disruption are huge. To meet customer needs companies, must start digitizing all existing automation along the entire value chain. This means a convergence of customers and business partners. The goal is to ma
posts.author: Chandrashekara RS

posts.title: 14 key benefits of using Leanworx Industry4.0
posts.content: LEANworx Industry 4.0 machine monitoring system gives you data from your machines 24/7, enables you to reduce waste of machine capacity, improve OEE and profits dramatically. Our users have seen these benefits: Stopped buying new machines - postponed CapEx by 2 years. Stopped working night shift - doing in 2 shifts what they were doing in 3. Improved operator retention - paying wages and incentives based on efficiency. Reduced downtime by 70 %. Reduced consumption of inserts and tools. Reduced consumption of furnace gases, electrical energy. Getting production data automatically into ERP. Reduced rejections, rework, getting data for SPC. Prevented machine breakdowns through Autonomous maintenance, Preventive maintenance Reduced downtime during machine breakdowns Eliminated paper entry on shop floor. More details: https://www.leanworxcloud.com/ Contact details : Girish +91 99455 15236 sales@leanworxcloud.com #industry4_0 #industry40 #industry4point0 #industry40 #machinemonitoring

posts.title: The Future of Work is Here! #Industry4.0 #Automation #Robotics #futureofwork
posts.content: As industries evolve, industrial robots are stepping in to transform the workplace. From boosting efficiency to tackling labor shortages, automation is reshaping the global economy in 2025. üíº‚öôÔ∏èWhy embrace robots? ‚úÖ Precision & Productivity: Robots handle repetitive tasks with unmatched accuracy. ‚úÖ Cost Savings: Reduce labor costs while scaling operations. ‚úÖ Empowering Workers: Free up humans for creative, high-value roles.But it‚Äôs not just about machines‚Äîit‚Äôs about collaboration. Humans + robots = a smarter, stronger workforce. üåçWhat‚Äôs your take on this shift? Let‚Äôs discuss how automation is shaping the future! üöÄ #Industry4.0 #Automation #Robotics #FutureOfWork
posts.author: Tony-used industrial robot

posts.title: How AI is Revolutionizing Manufacturing! üè≠ü§ñ #AI #Manufacturing #Industry4.0 PART 1
posts.content: How AI is Revolutionizing Manufacturing! üè≠ü§ñ #AI #Manufacturing #Industry4.0 PART 1 Introduction: Welcome back to our channel! Today, we‚Äôre exploring how artificial intelligence is transforming the manufacturing industry. From predictive maintenance to quality control, AI is building the future of manufacturing. Stay tuned to discover the incredible ways AI is making manufacturing more efficient, precise, and innovative! Section 1: The Role of AI in Manufacturing Overview of AI and its applications in manufacturing. Historical context: The evolution of manufacturing technology. Key technologies: Machine learning, computer vision, and robotics. Section 2: Predictive Maintenance How AI predicts equipment failures before they happen. Examples of predictive maintenance systems and their impact. Benefits: Reduced downtime, cost savings, and increased efficiency.
